label: Description
value: Commemorates Commodore Isaac Hull and the battle between the "Constitution" and the "Guirriere". Portrait roundel of Hull at bottom, personifications of Victory and Fame on either side. Fame holds a laurel wreath over Hull's head, while Victory is playing a trumpet.  A scene of ships appears above this, near top. Blue ground diapered with six-point stars. Foliate or laurel bands along right and left margins.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Jones and Erwin, Inc.

label: Notes
value: Commemorates Commodore Isaac Hull and the battle between the "Constitution" and the "Guirriere". Portrait roundel of Hull at bottom, personifications of Victory and Fame on either side. Fame holds a laurel wreath over Hull's head, while Victory is playing a trumpet. A scene of ships appears above this, near top. Blue ground diapered with six-point stars. Foliate or laurel bands along right and left margins.

label: Description
value: Length, probably from a skirt, of quilted linen, with wide border along one side of block-printed linen, also quilted. Design a natural size all-over floral pattern in red, dark red, light blue and brown for outlines.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: relief printed linen, quilted

label: Dimensions
value: H x W: 217.2 x 76.2 cm (7 ft. 1 1/2 in. x 30 in.) Other (border): 37.5 cm (14 3/4 in.)

label: Description
value: Pleated fan. Parchment leaf with pen and ink drawing showing bacchanalian scene of the drunken Silenus, a figure connected with Dionysus and vintage festivals, lying in the company of his retinue. Reverse: strap ornament and drapery in black line with hatching and black border. Incised and pierced ivory sticks with rococo scroll work and mother-of-pearl inlay. Glass stone at rivet.

label: Physical description
value: Front and back leaves of fine parchment with pen and ink drawing, carved, incised and pierced ivory sticks with mother-of-pearl inlay, glass stone at rivet

label: Dimensions
value: H x W (open): 28 x 44.5 cm (11 x 17 1/2 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1955: Cole Porter collection; 1953: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Pleated fan. Painted parchment leaf. Obverse: Romantic groups and still life in medallions bordered with gold; blue background scattered with gold leaves and pink flowering branches. Reverse: Chinoiserie landscape. Carved, pierced, painted, and gessoed ivory sticks showing figures and flowers in scrolled cartouches and fretwork; colored foil behind the guards. Glass stone at the rivet.

label: Physical description
value: Painted parchment leaf; carved, pierced, painted, and gessoed ivory sticks with colored foil behind the guards, glass stone at the rivet

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1955: Cole Porter collection; 1953: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Pleated fan. Leaf of 17th century white Milanese bobbin lace. Carved and painted ivory sticks with flowers and feathers. Guards carved with baroque detail and painted. Rivet is set with faceted glass. Gilt metal bail.

label: Physical description
value: Linen bobbin lace leaf, carved and painted ivory sticks, rivet set with faceted glass, gilt metal bail

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1955: Cole Porter collection; 1953: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Pleated fan. Black glazed paper leaf painted with gouache. Obverse: a Chinoiserie scene of figures in a garden; gilded swags. Reverse: black ground with 3 flower sprays. Sticks of carved, incised, pierced and painted ivory showing figures and scrolls. Glass stone at the rivet.

label: Physical description
value: Glazed paper leaf painted with gouache, carved, incised, pierced and painted ivory sticks, glass stone at the rivet

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1955: Cole Porter collection; 1953: acquired by the Museum.

Storm King, Northern Entrance to the Highlands, Hudson River

label: Description
value: A sketch of Storm King Mountain from across the Hudson River at the base of Breakneck Ridge; Center left, sailboats under sail on the Hudson River and an American colonial house on the west bank of the river.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and wash, gouache, graphite on paper mounted to board

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mary T. Cockroft

label: Description
value: Ascending serpentine design of vine tendrils and flowering branches. Two repeats to the width in drop-repeating relationship. Orange, pink, blue and white flowers, green leaves and stems with black outlines. Printed in ouline with forms (blocks?) and stencils, on linen ground. Floral patterned wachstuch or wax cloth.

label: Physical description
value: Block printed and hand painted on linen

label: Provenance
value: From Schloss Wilhelmsthal near Kassel, Germany. Kassel Museum no. 252.

label: Description
value: Symmetrical non-repeating design, in close arrangement, of foliate and floral forms. Dark green flock on gold.

label: Provenance
value: From Schloss Ehreshoven near Cologne on the Rhine. Acquired by Kassel Museum 1941. Their number 201.

label: Description
value: Framework of leafy branches enclosing vignettes in gold and green foil of trees and deer. The two vignettes are different and in diagonal relationship to one another. Printed on taupe ground. Stamped gold and green foil.

label: Notes
value: Framework of leafy branches enclosing vignettes in gold and green foil of trees and deer. The two vignettes are different and in diagonal relationship to one another. Printed on taupe ground. Stamped gold and green foil.

label: Description
value: Depiction of Juno, in white dress, standing on a plinth with a large peacock. Printed on a blue background.

label: Notes
value: Depiction of Juno, in white dress, standing on a plinth with a large peacock. Printed on a blue background.
"Mother and Child" from the series "The Ages of Man"

label: Description
value: Standing figure of woman in flowing robes cradling child in her arms, on stone base. Printed in grisaille on blue ground.

label: Description
value: Female personification of Africa wearing Egyptian dress standing in contrapposto stance, holding up jug in right hand. Printed in monochrome ocher on a wood grained or faux bois background simulating oak.

label: Physical description
value: Block printed on paper, combed ground

label: Description
value: Group of three putti with dolphin, in pale browns, at top. Below this a scrollwork cartouche or medallion in darker browns at the center of which is a satyr-like mask in pale browns. Printed on pale blue glazed ground.

label: Description
value: Tall vase or urn in Renaissance style filled with bouquet of roses and other flowers, its base encircled by leafy foliage. Rests on a carved console. Printed in grisaille or sepia tones on green glazed ground.

label: Description
value: Horizontal cluster of flowers and leaves is arranged in vertical columns, every other cluster being turned around. Horizontally the repeat is dropped so that the flower clusters interlock. Printed on an irise or rainbow background.

label: Provenance
value: From the house of the Greisheim family, now demolished, which was built by Nahl 1800 at 41 Obere Konigstrasse, Kassel. A store now occupies the site.

label: Notes
value: Horizontal cluster of flowers and leaves is arranged in vertical columns, every other cluster being turned around. Horizontally the repeat is dropped so that the flower clusters interlock. Printed on an irise or rainbow background.

label: Description
value: A man in a white smock shows the story of a murder to a woman and a little girl. He points to a sheet of four pictures which is suspended from the top of a pole which stands on the ground. Persons are dressed in clothes of the 1840s and are situated in a park or garden with balustrades at back; printed in black, white and shades of green on pale green ground.

label: Description
value: Drop-repeating gold quatrefoils centered with formalized gold foil flowers and leaves. The spaces between are embellished with foliate arabesques and flower medallions, all the elements being connected by beaded strapwork in grisaille.

label: Description
value: Black and white portrait ribbon of President Warren G. Harding in an elongated octagonal frame filled with stars. Eagle is on top of the frame. Inscription on the bottom reads: '21–'25 Our President.

label: Description
value: Unfinished piece of beaded knitting, still on five fine steel knitting needles, probably intended to make a bag.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk thread, cut steel beads Technique: knitted

label: Description
value: Flying phoenix holding curving sprays of tree peony in deep blue cut velvet on a rectangular foundation of tarnished gold. Border of stylized lotus and leaves reserved in gold on deep blue cut velvet ground. Narrow horizontal panel overlaid across top with two vertical pleats. Circular dragon medalliions flanking lobed central medallion with lucky monogram. Faced with blue cotton.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, gilded paper, cotton lining Technique: cut velvet

label: Description
value: Deep golden yellow satin with symmetrical design of a phoenix in floral arabesque on either side of large floral rosette. In bright silk satin stitch with details in French knots, outlined in couched gold thread. Cuff band of orange and black ribbed cloth brocaded in paper gold. Lined with salmon pink satin, now faded.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: embroidered with satin and couching stitches, French knots on satin ground

label: Description
value: Dark blue satin embroidered and couched with stylized rolling wave design with curling crests; dots, grouped pearls (?), within the waves. In greens, blues, and white, outlined and accented with gold. Lined with salmon pink satin now faded. Five satin button-loops on each band and five small round hollow brass buttons.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: satin, silk, metallic threads Technique: embroidered, couched

label: Description
value: Dark blue satin embroidered and couched with stylized rolling wave design with curling crests; dots, grouped pearls (?), within the waves. In greens, blues, and white, outlined and accented with gold. Lined with salmon pink satin now faded. Five satin button-loops on each band and five small round hollow brass buttons.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: satin, silk, metallic threads Technique: embroidered, couched

label: Description
value: Pleated fan with double leaf. Obverse: Printed (probably lithograph) and heavily hand-colored paper showing scene of Europa and the Bull surrounded by figures and putti. Heavily embellished gilded borders. Reverse: parchment painted with flowers. Pierced and incised mother-of-pearl sticks with applied metallic foil showing equestrian figures and scrolls. Gilt metal bail.

label: Physical description
value: Hand-colored printed paper and parchment leaf, pierced and incised mother-of-pearl sticks with applied metallic foil, gilt metal bail

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1955: Mabel Choate collection; 1955: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Fragment of brocaded silk with a symmetrical  scene of a man holding an parasol over a woman, flanking a tree with large fruits. In pale green, blue, orange, pink and off-white on a green ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, wool Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade)

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1955: Amy Pleadwell collection; 1955: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Single drop-repeating motif: a cluster of roses and other flowers enframed by scrollwork, leaves and small flowers and a diaper of lines and dots in gold. Printed in gold, pink and dark red on red ground.
